intro: Rhynchosinapis nivalis, commonly known as the snow lily, is a rare alpine plant found in high-altitude regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has a short, thick rhizome and produces narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are adapted to cold, nutrient-poor soils. It thrives in rocky or gravelly habitats and is often found in mountain meadows and tundra environments. Due to its limited distribution and sensitivity to environmental changes, it is considered a vulnerable species.
